name: tatsu-lab/alpaca
description: The Alpaca dataset, developed by tatsu-lab, is a unique collection of 52,000 instructions and demonstrations generated by OpenAI's text-davinci-003 engine. This data is instrumental in instruction-tuning language models, allowing them to better understand and follow instructions. The dataset was created using the data generation pipeline from the Self-Instruct framework, with the text-davinci-003 engine replacing the original data source. For further information, please refer to the dataset page at https://huggingface.co/datasets/tatsu-lab/alpaca.
citeAs: @misc{alpaca,   author = {Rohan Taori and Ishaan Gulrajani and Tianyi Zhang and Yann Dubois and Xuechen Li and Carlos Guestrin and Percy Liang and Tatsunori B. Hashimoto },   title = {Stanford Alpaca: An Instruction-following LLaMA model},   year = {2023},   publisher = {GitHub},   journal = {GitHub repository},   howpublished = {\url{https://github.com/tatsu-lab/stanford_alpaca}}, }
creator: tatsu-lab
